diagnosis.final_diagnosis: calciÔ¨Åed fetal rhabdomyoma of the tricuspid valve
diagnosis.differential_diagnosis: dystrophic calcification due to inflammatory disease (fetal endocarditis) or amorphous cardiac tumor
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The final pathologic diagnosis was made based on histological examination of the lesions which showed fibromyxoid stroma and isolated spindle cells with eosinophilic cytoplasm, consistent with fetal rhabdomyoma. The clinical presentation included severe tricuspid valve obstruction and pulmonary hypertension in both siblings.
